org.grouplens.lenskit.data.source

Class TextDataSourceBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.data.source.TextDataSourceBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<DataSource>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CSVDataSourceBuilder

    public class TextDataSourceBuilder
extends Object
implements org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<DataSource>

    Builder for text file data sources.

    Since:
    2.2

      • setName

        public TextDataSourceBuilder setName(String n)

        Set the data source name. If unspecified, a name is derived from the file.

        Parameters:
        n - The name of the data source.
        See Also:
        setFile(java.io.File)

      • getName

        @Nonnull
public String getName()

      • getFile

        public File getFile()

        Get the input file.

        Returns:
        The input file for the builder.

      • setFile

        public TextDataSourceBuilder setFile(File file)

        Set the input file. If unspecified, the name (see setName(String)) is used as the file name.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to read ratings from.

      • setFile

        public TextDataSourceBuilder setFile(String fn)

        Set the input file by name.

        Parameters:
        fn - The input file name.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • getFormat

        public EventFormat getFormat()

        Get the currently-configured event format.

        Returns:
        The configured event format.

      • setFormat

        public TextDataSourceBuilder setFormat(EventFormat fmt)

        Set the event format. This method overrides any previous calls to set the delimiter or columns, and disables any future calls.

        Parameters:
        fmt - The format.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • getDelimiter

        public String getDelimiter()

        Get the input delimiter.

      • setDelimiter

        public TextDataSourceBuilder setDelimiter(String delim)

        Set the input field delimiter. The default is the tab character.

        Parameters:
        delim - The input delimiter.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a format has been specified with setFormat(EventFormat).

      • build

        public TextDataSource build()

        Build the data source. At least one of setName(String) or setFile(java.io.File) must be called prior to building.

        Specified by:
        build in interface org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<DataSource>
        Returns:
        The configured data source.
